chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul A. Puccillo

records.addlTxt:
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Weapons or explosives,  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Eileen O'D

Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson in court for Paul A. Puccillo. Defendant Paul A. Puccillo appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Johnson's bond motion. State stipulates to amending the bond to a signature bond. Court amends bond to a $1,000 signature bond with the same conditions. Attorney Johnson states he does have an offer and needs to discuss with the DE.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson in court for Paul A. Puccillo. Defendant Paul A. Puccillo appeared by video, in custody. ASJA has not been entered yet so Judge Rossell can not do anything on this case yet.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul A. Puccillo appeared with Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.    DE requests substitution of Br 1; Br 2 assigned.(DE other case has co-def assigned to Br 2).  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Johnson.   Clerk HMcBride.  Report reviewed.  Parties stip to the findings in the report.  Court finds DE competent to proceed. PH 9/6 945am. Time limits waived by parties and court.  Bond continued.
